STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 31, 2024
Melynda Elizabeth Williams
Whaley Children's Center Journey House
1201 N Grand Traverse ST.
Flint, MI. 48503-1312
RE: License#: CB250410563
Dear Ms. Williams:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 10/17/2024 . The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• No technical assistance was requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No consultation was required or requested.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed and discussed on site on
10/16/2024. The Chief Administrator (CA) reported there were no licensing
violations or required CAPS submitted to DCWL during this reporting period. She
reported of the three planned and unplanned moves from the independent living

program this year, one youth was non-compliant with the program resulting in a
request for replacement to another independent living plus program. A second
youth moved out of the program without approval ending his placement and the
third youth successfully completed the program. The CA reported the assessment
finds that there are trends that are related to frequent placement changes. She
said prior instability may increase the likelihood of future disruptions, creating a
cycle of instability and age group vulnerability. She reported that adolescents tend
to have higher disruption rates, particularly those who are aging out of foster care
and transitioning into independent living.
Financial Overview
The agency financial audit dated December 31, 2023, and 2022 conducted by an
independent certified public accountant was reviewed and indicates the agency is
current with obtaining their annual audit. The agency submitted their annual
financial budget indicating the agency is financially secure.
Staff and Youth Interviews
One Independent Living Specialist, ILP Manager and the Independent Living
Director were interviewed on 10/16/2024 on-site. Staff reported they enjoy
working at the agency. Staff enjoy working with and helping the youth in their
program. Independent Living staff reported their supervisors, and the
administration is helpful, supportive, and very knowledgeable. It was reported that
the administration makes decisions that are beneficial to the agency. Staff
reported no concerns or suggestions for improvement.
One Independent Living Youth was interviewed on site on 10/16/24. The youth
reported she is active in the program and loves the program very much. She said
she participates with her education/vocational needs, abiding by the program rules
and her individual contract. The youth reported she is up to date with her medical
and dental needs. The youth said staff are very helpful and supportive and that
the youths have lots of food to eat. The youth reported had no safety concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency has adequate space for staff to work and provide confidentiality. No
safety issues were noted.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
This agency is not contracted with MDHHS to provide foster care placement or
certification services; therefore this is not applicable.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
10/30/2024

Pinkey Brown Date
